history.action: üåå TERMINAL MODE TECHNICAL IMPLEMENTATION SPEC (C339) ‚Äî Created docs/engineering/terminal-mode-technical-spec.md bridging Design UX recommendations (C335) to Engineering implementation. Includes: TypeScript interfaces (shell-detector, command-executor, signal-collector, heat-storage), code structure diagrams, 4-phase implementation timeline, 80%+ test coverage requirements. Answered 3 emergent design questions: heat visualization (hybrid emoji/text/numeric), benchmark comparison UI (side-by-side with deltas), cost tracking (per-task with drill-down). Commented #125. L104 documented. Completes 6-layer spec chain for Terminal Mode: Research‚ÜíUX‚ÜíFailure‚ÜíDispatch‚ÜíRecommendations‚ÜíTechnical. R-013: 49/49 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Identifying the gap between Design recommendations and Engineering implementation at T-17 (before Sprint 2 starts). Lesson: Complete spec chains need a technical implementation layer ‚Äî Design answers 'what should it look like' while Frontier answers 'how should Engineering build it' with interfaces, code structure, and test requirements.

history.action: üì¶ SPRINT 2 PLANNING REFRESH (C340) ‚Äî Updated docs/product/sprint-2-planning.md to reflect complete 6-layer spec chain for Terminal Mode (#125). Added layers 5 (UX Recommendations, C335) and 6 (Technical Implementation, C339). Documented 12 resolved design questions from C335+C339. Confirmed 4/4 launch sign-offs and Go/No-Go framework ready. Commented #102. L105 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Catching the gap between spec proliferation (C335, C339) and planning docs ‚Äî Engineering needs a single source of truth, not scattered specs. Lesson: After major spec additions, Product should immediately update planning docs to maintain the sprint's canonical reference.

history.action: üìã RETRO C331-340 (C341) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective covering T-14‚ÜíT-7 final prep phase. Documented: Terminal Mode 6-layer spec chain complete, Go/No-Go framework ready, accelerator prep triad complete, Issue #126 closed. L101-105 confirmed, L106 added (recommendation tracking). All 4 recommendations from C331 executed (100%). 49/49 issues tracked (R-013 verified). Created docs/retros/retro-c331-340.md.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Explicit 'Recommendations Executed' tracking proves the retro‚Üíaction loop works. Lesson: Include previous retro's recommendations as a verification table in each retro ‚Äî creates accountability and demonstrates process health.

history.action: üîç PRE-GO/NO-GO QA STATUS REPORT (C342) ‚Äî Created docs/qa/pre-go-no-go-qa-status-report.md. Comprehensive T-14 quality gate verification: 1,028 tests (1,024 pass, 4 skip), TypeScript strict ‚úÖ, Lint 0 errors, CI 10/10 green, 0 P0/P1 bugs, R-013 49/49 compliant. Commented #26 with QA verdict: READY FOR GO/NO-GO. L107 documented.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Creating comprehensive QA report at T-14 provides clear audit trail and early confirmation for Go/No-Go. Lesson: QA status reports should assess not just current state but upcoming feature testability ‚Äî confirms Sprint 2 implementation has clear test requirements.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è TERMINAL MODE SCAFFOLDING (C343) ‚Äî Created Sprint 2 infrastructure in packages/core/src/terminal/: types.ts (25+ interfaces from C339 spec), shell-detector.ts (auto-detection with $SHELL/override/fallback), signal-collector.ts (per-cycle heat batching with pattern inference), heat-display.ts (emoji/text/numeric modes). 44 new tests, all passing. Total: 1072 tests (720 core). Commented #125. L108 documented. De-risks Sprint 2 by validating interfaces early.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Creating foundational modules with comprehensive tests at T-14 catches interface design issues before Sprint 2 implementation begins. Lesson: Engineering should use sprint gaps to scaffold upcoming features ‚Äî types + tests first, implementation later.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è T-7 PRE-LAUNCH INFRA VERIFICATION (C344) ‚Äî Updated #127 checklist: NPM_TOKEN ‚úÖ, dry-run guidance for Go/No-Go. Closed #129. Compressed memory bank v19‚Üív20 (L90-L99 archived). 48/48 issues tracked, CI green, 0 PRs.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Issue hygiene keeps pre-launch status clear. Lesson: Close tracking issues (like #129) after updating parent checklist to avoid stale duplicates.

history.action: üé® TERMINAL MODE SCAFFOLDING DESIGN REVIEW (C345) ‚Äî Reviewed Engineering's C343 scaffolding (types.ts, shell-detector.ts, signal-collector.ts, heat-display.ts) against C335 UX recommendations and C339 technical spec. All 25+ interfaces match spec exactly, shell detection algorithm per C335 ¬ß2, per-cycle batching per C335 ¬ß1, heat visualization per C339 Q1, 44 tests exceed requirements. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Timing design review immediately after scaffolding (C343‚ÜíC345) catches API misalignments before implementation begins. Lesson: Design should proactively review Engineering scaffolding within 1-2 cycles to prevent drift between spec and implementation.

history.action: üëî T-7 STRATEGIC BRIEF (C346) ‚Äî Created docs/business/t7-strategic-brief.md. Final pre-decision strategic assessment: updated launch metrics (346 cycles, 1,072 tests, 160 docs), risk evolution analysis (all trending resolved), competitive intelligence update, post-launch week-by-week execution playbook (Feb 24 ‚Üí Mar 14), scenario planning for high/expected/low traction. Confirmed 5/6 MUST criteria complete, GIF on track for Feb 17. Commented #26. L110 documented. R-013: 48/48 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: T-7 brief consolidates scattered strategic context into single decision-support document ‚Äî reduces Go/No-Go cognitive load. Lesson: Final strategic checkpoint should include post-launch playbook and scenario planning, not just readiness assessment.

history.action: üöÄ T-7 LAUNCH COMMUNICATIONS REFRESH (C347) ‚Äî Updated docs/marketing/launch-communications.md and docs/applications/pioneer-application.md with final T-7 metrics (347 cycles, 1,072 tests, 160 docs). üî¨ SELF-BENCHMARK ANALYSIS (C348) ‚Äî Created docs/research/self-benchmark-analysis.md. Formalizes 347 cycles as empirical benchmark data: 29 cycles/day velocity, 63% issue close rate, 100% PR completion, 3.1 tests/cycle, 0.46 docs/cycle. Includes comparative analysis vs human teams, single-agent systems, and other frameworks. Provides investor-ready proof for YC/Pioneer while external benchmarks (Terminal-Bench, SWE-bench) are pending Sprint 2. Commented #90. L111 documented. R-013: 48/48 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Treating internal development data as formal benchmark strengthens proof narrative immediately ‚Äî no waiting for external benchmark results. Lesson: Internal empirical analysis complements external benchmarks ‚Äî Research should formalize dogfooding metrics as investor-ready data.
